items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 Launches to International Space Station - NASA
items.content_text: Four crew members of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 mission launched at 5:15 a.m. EST Friday from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in

items.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Dragon Hatches Open, Crew-12 Enters Station and Joins Expedition 74 - NASA
items.content_text: NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev entered the International Space Station at 5 p.m. EST after opening the hatches between the space station and the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft.

items.title: SpaceX Crew-12 Docks to Station Beginning Long-Duration Mission - NASA
items.content_text: NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev arrived at the International Space Station as the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft docked with the orbiting complex at 3:15 p.m. EST.

items.title: Archival Data From NASA’s NEOWISE Tracks Star Turning Into Black Hole
items.content_text: Researchers used data from the now-retired spacecraft and other space and ground-based observatories helped to piece together the mystery of a ‘failed’ supernova.

items.title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Completes First AI-Planned Drive on Mars
items.content_text: The team for the six-wheeled scientist used a vision-capable AI to create a safe route over the Red Planet’s surface without the input of human route planners.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Radar Mission Peers Through Clouds to See Mississippi River Delta
items.content_text: A new image from the NISAR mission shows off the satellite’s ability to reveal details of Earth’s surfaces. The science team also released new sample data.

items.title: NASA Analysis Shows La Niña Limited Sea Level Rise in 2025
items.content_text: A mild La Niña caused greater rainfall over the Amazon basin, which offset rising sea levels due to record warming of Earth’s oceans.

items.title: Networks Keeping NASA’s Artemis II Mission Connected
items.content_text: Artemis missions rely on both the Near Space Network, managed by NASA Goddard, and the Deep Space Network, managed by the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

items.title: NASA’s Juno Measures Thickness of Europa’s Ice Shell
items.content_text: Results from the solar-powered spacecraft provide a new measurement of the thickness of the ice shell encasing the Jovian moon’s ocean.

items.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
items.content_text: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

items.title: NASA Reveals New Details About Dark Matter’s Influence on Universe
items.content_text: With the Webb telescope’s unprecedented sensitivity, scientists are learning more about dark matter’s influence on stars, galaxies, and even planets like Earth.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.title: Rocket Lab Prepares To Launch Latest Hypersonic Test Mission for Defense Innovation Unit | Rocket Lab
items.content_text: Long Beach, Calif. February 12, 2026: Rocket Lab Corporation (Nasdaq: RKLB) (“Rocket Lab” or “the Company”), a global leader in launch services and space systems, today announced its next launch is a dedicated mission on its HASTE rocket for the Department of War’s Defense Innovation Unit (DIU).

items.title: Mission Success: Rocket Lab Launches Korean Earth-Imaging Satellite, Completes 2nd Launch in 8 Days | Rocket Lab
items.content_text: Long Beach, Calif. January 30, 2026: Rocket Lab Corporation (Nasdaq: RKLB) (“Rocket Lab” or “the Company”), a global leader in launch services and space systems, today successfully launched its 81st Electron rocket and second launch in eight days to deploy a satellite for an Earth-observation…

items.title: Rocket Lab’s Hungry Hippo Fairing Arrives at Virginia Launch Site Ahead of First Neutron Flight  | Rocket Lab
items.content_text: Long Beach, California. January 26, 2026 – Rocket Lab Corporation (Nasdaq: RKLB) (“Rocket Lab” or “the Company”), a global leader in launch services and space systems, today announced the arrival of its “Hungry Hippo” captive fairing – a world-first for a commercial rocket – to Virginia for its…

items.title: Rocket Lab Neutron Test Update | Rocket Lab
items.content_text: Long Beach, Calif. January 21, 2026: Rocket Lab Corporation (Nasdaq: RKLB) (“Rocket Lab” or “the Company”), a global leader in launch services and space systems, today announced an update relating to the development of its Neutron rocket.
